intro: Sebastiania fiebrigii, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with a central yellow star. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with a distinctive yellowish-green color. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
